paragraphs.content: Psalm 69
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 69

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.

paragraphs.content: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

paragraphs.content: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

paragraphs.content: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.

paragraphs.content: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

paragraphs.content: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.

paragraphs.content: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

paragraphs.content: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.

paragraphs.content: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

paragraphs.content: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

paragraphs.content: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

paragraphs.content: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.

paragraphs.content: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Lord, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

paragraphs.content: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

paragraphs.content: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

paragraphs.content: Hear me, O LORD; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear me, O Lord; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

paragraphs.content: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

paragraphs.content: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.

paragraphs.content: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

paragraphs.content: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

paragraphs.content: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.

paragraphs.content: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

paragraphs.content: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

paragraphs.content: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.

paragraphs.content: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

paragraphs.content: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

paragraphs.content: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

paragraphs.content: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

paragraphs.content: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

paragraphs.content: This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This also shall please the Lord better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

paragraphs.content: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

paragraphs.content: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

paragraphs.content: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

paragraphs.content: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
